tool.name: CreateMuskingumKfacFile

param.name: in_drainage_line_features
param.dialogReference: This is the river network file with length and slope attributes.

param.name: stream_ID
param.dialogReference: This is the unique identifier of each river reach (e.g COMID, HydroID, ..).

param.name: length
param.dialogReference: This is the field with the length of the river reach.

param.name: slope
param.dialogReference: This is the field with the slope of the river reach.

param.name: co
param.dialogReference: This is the flow wave celerity in m/s. Default is 1km/hr or 0.27778 m/s.

param.name: in_formula
param.expression: River Length/Co | Eta*River Length/Sqrt(River Slope) | Eta*River Length/Sqrt(River Slope) [0.05, 0.95]
param.dialogReference:
There are three options:

1. River Length/Co

2. Eta*River Length/Sqrt(River Slope)

3. Eta*River Length/Sqrt(River Slope) [0.05, 0.95] - this option filters out slopes outside the 5th and 95th percentiles.

Note: Eta = Average(River Length/Co of all rivers) / Average(River Length/Sqrt(River Slope) of all rivers).

param.name: in_network_connectivity_file
param.dialogReference: This is the RAPID network connectivity file (i.e. rapid_connect.csv).

param.name: out_muskingum_kfac_file
param.dialogReference: This is the Muskingum Kfac file generated for RAPID (i.e. kfac.csv).

tool.summary: This tool is used to generate values of Kfac based on the flow wave celerity (Co) for the basin as well as length and slope of each stream reach.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool is used to generate values of Kfac based on the flow wave celerity (Co) for the basin as well as length and slope of each stream reach.
